name: To Kill a Mockingbird
descip: A powerful exploration of racism and injustice in the American South.                    --Harper lee

descip: A classic romance novel that also delves into themes of class and society.               -- Jane Austen

descip: A novel set in the Jazz Age that explores themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.               -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

descip: A psychological novel that delves into the mind of a troubled protagonist.           --Fyodor Dostoevsky
A dystopian novel that explores the dangers of totalitarianism and surveillance.             --George Orwell

descip: An epic tale of obsession and revenge set against the backdrop of whaling.               --Herman Melville

descip: A coming-of-age story featuring the iconic character Holden Caulfield.               --J.D. Salinger

descip: A classic Gothic novel featuring a strong-willed heroine.            --Charlotte Brontë

descip: A fantasy epic that transports readers to the world of Middle-earth.                 --J.R.R. Tolkien

descip: An ancient Greek epic poem that tells the adventures of Odysseus.                        --Homer

name: Frankenstein
descip: The classic Gothic tale of the scientist Victor Frankenstein and his monstrous creation.                 --Mary Shelley

name: Don Quixote
descip: Often considered the first modern novel, it follows the adventures of a delusional knight.               --Miguel de Cervantes

descip: An epic novel that chronicles the lives of Russian aristocrats during the Napoleonic Wars.               --Leo Tolstoy

descip: A classic novel about sin, guilt, and redemption in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts.          --Nathaniel Hawthorne
